meta.content: Broken Bow Public Schools is a progressive C-1 school located in central Nebraska. Broken Bow Public School is accredited by the State of Nebraska and the North Central Association of Secondary Schools and Colleges continuously since 1915.School District 21-0025 (Broken Bow) in Custer County covers 426 square miles. Students attend classes in four attendance centers: New Discoveries Preschool, North Park Elementary, Middle School and High School. Build Character, Optimize Learning, Widen Opportunities.

Broken Bow Public Schools is a progressive C-1 school located in central Nebraska. Broken Bow Public School is accredited by the State of Nebraska and the North Central Association of Secondary Schools and Colleges continuously since 1915.School District 21-0025 (Broken Bow) in Custer County covers 426 square miles. Students attend classes in four attendance centers: New Discoveries Preschool, North Park Elementary, Middle School and High School. Build Character, Optimize Learning, Widen Opportunities.

cmsmasters_slider_post post-404 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-featured

div.p: Broken Bow Public Schools is a progressive C-1 school located in central Nebraska. The school is accredited by the State of Nebraska and the North Central Association of Secondary Schools and Colleges continuously since 1915.

School District 21-0025 (Broken Bow) in Custer County covers 426 square miles. Students attend classes in four attendance centers: New Discoveries Preschool, North Park Elementary, Middle School and High School.

In addition to providing a sound educational background, Broken Bow Public Schools offers a wide selection of extra-curricular activities including football, basketball, wrestling, volleyball, track, golf, one-act, and quiz bowl in addition to a wide variety of special interest clubs.

The school district does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the nondiscrimination policies:

Name: Darren Tobey
Title: Superintendent
Address: 323 North 7th Avenue, Broken Bow NE 68822
Telephone: 308-872-6821
Email: darren.tobey@bbps.org
For further information on notice of nondiscrimination, visit:
http://wdcrobcolp01.ed.gov/CFAPPS/OCR/contactus.cfm for the address and phone number of the office that serves your area, or call 1-800-421-3481.
For additional prohibited discrimination and related information, please review school district policy 3053-Nondiscrimination.
North Park Elementary | 1135 N H St. | 308-872-2982
